After careful consideration of your preferences and interests, here are some potential recommendations:

The Violent Kind (2010) - Directed by Sam Mendes, this dark psychological thriller follows a young woman named Lila (played by Lily Taylor)) who becomes possessed by a malevolent entity after being drugged at her home by one of her roommates, the female college student Anna (played by Emma Stone)). The story is told from both inside and outside of the body of Lila, as she struggles to come to terms with what has happened to her. The film received generally positive reviews upon its release in 2010.
Starring: Lily Taylor, Emma Stone

2. Little Fockers (2009) - Directed by Robert Zemeckis, this family comedy follows the life of two wealthy New York City couples: John Diller and his wife Lisa (played by Susan Sarandon)); and Bill Ford and his wife Jane (played by Harrison Ford and Kim Basinger)). The story is told from both inside and outside of the bodies of John and Bill, as they struggle to come to terms with what has happened to them. The film received generally positive reviews upon its release in 2009.
Starring: Susan Sarandon, Harrison Ford

Finally, I would recommend "The Lucky Ones" as it is a compelling drama about three soldiers returning from World War II facing the peaceful life problems of each other. The film features Mark L. Young playing one of the soldiers, John Heard playing another soldier, and Katherine LaNasa playing yet another soldier, all of whom are portrayed in a nuanced way that allows them to be perceived as both heroic and flawed individuals.
